availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick O'Bannon Hawes (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and 2nd lieut, 1st lieut, & capt 14th KY Vols USA)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John W. Hawes and Lydia Hawes. Married to Amelia M. Hampton Hawes in Boyd County, Kentucky, on October 21, 1863. Graduated from Indiana Asbury University in Greencastle, Indiana, in June 1860. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain from June 12, 1862, to January 31, 1865.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 274.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 437.
